Excited to partner with the Mercedes-AMG PETRONAS F1 Team to apply our technology from factory to circuit, turning massive volumes of data into real-time insights that help drive performance at the highest level!

[!\[\]()](https://www.linkedin.com/in/judsonalthoff?trk=public_post_reshare_feed-actor-image)

[Judson Althoff](https://www.linkedin.com/in/judsonalthoff?trk=public_post_reshare_feed-actor-name)

6h

We are thrilled to announce a new multi-year partnership with the Mercedes-AMG PETRONAS Formula One team ahead of the 2026 season. By putting Microsoft‚Äôs technologies at the center of racing performance, we are turning data into real-time intelligence that powers faster decisions, smarter strategies, and sustained competitive advantage‚Äîon and off the track.

Read today‚Äôs press announcement to learn more: [https://lnkd.in/g4dcasSH](https://lnkd.in/g4dcasSH?trk=public_post_reshare-text).

What makes partnerships like this compelling is not the data itself, but the operating discipline behind it. Translating factory-scale intelligence into split-second decisions on the circuit requires clarity of ownership, trust in systems, and judgment under pressure. That is where technology stops being infrastructure and becomes a competitive advantage, especially at the level where milliseconds matter, as with Mercedes-AMG PETRONAS F1 Team.

This is a powerful example of data-driven performance at the highest level. Formula 1 is essentially real-time decision-making under extreme constraints, and putting Microsoft‚Äôs tech stack at the core turns telemetry into strategic advantage.

What‚Äôs exciting is how this partnership goes beyond racing, these learnings will likely shape how enterprises use real-time analytics, AI, and cloud for faster, smarter decisions in business too. Racing is just the most visible proving ground. [Satya Nadella](https://www.linkedin.com/in/satyanadella?trk=public_post_comment-text)
